image.altText: The crumpled front of a white BMW SUV, surrounded by emergency services tape.

items.synopsis: Five people are dead and several others are injured after a car drives through a beer garden at Daylesford, 110 kilometres north-west of Melbourne, on Sunday evening.

title.children: Witnesses describe 'horrific' scene after car runs into Victorian pub beer garden, killing five

image.altText: A sun burning bright in an orange sky above clouds on the horizon.

items.synopsis: SunCable wants to build what it calls the world's largest renewable energy project and has identified Bell Bay in northern Tasmania as the potential site for its advanced cable manufacturing facility.

title.children: Billionaire's $30 billion renewables project announces plan for cable plant

image.altText: Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese speaks during the China International Import Expo.

items.synopsis: The trip is expected to be heavy with symbolism, marking the 50th anniversary of Gough Whitlam's historic visit to China.

title.children: Albanese says Australia and China must 'cooperate wherever we can' in landmark visit to Shanghai

image.altText: Jordan's King Abdullah II and Queen Rania walking in formal wear beside a fence.

items.synopsis: As the war between Israel and Gaza escalates, the conflict is shifting dynamics within the Middle East. In Jordan, the outbreak of violence has evoked longstanding fears the kingdom cannot remain immune to regional instability.

title.children: Why an 'extraordinary' statement by Queen Rania was the first sign of shifting priorities in Jordan

image.altText: an offensive poster of adolf hitler holding mask of israeli prime minister benjamin nethanyahu on a road sign

items.synopsis: The posters are the latest in a string of apparent anti-Jewish incidents in Sydney in recent weeks, following the outbreak of the Israel-Gaza war.

title.children: Posters in Sydney showing Hitler holding mask of Israeli prime minister's face under police investigation

image.altText: Scott Morrison, Danny Danon and Boris Johnson stand in a line in front of the Israeli flag

items.synopsis: Former PM Scott Morrison flies into Israel to "demonstrate solidarity" with Israel and the Jewish community, as protesters gather outside the Israeli PM's residence to call for his resignation and the immediate release of hostages.

title.children: Morrison flies to Jerusalem as thousands of Israelis call for Netanyahu's resignation

image.altText: Stephanie, Zoe and Oliver sitting close together and smiling at the camera

items.synopsis: Stephanie says a letter from the National Disability Insurance Agency that said her six-year-old daughter could lose her funding earlier than expected came as a shock.

title.children: Mother shocked by NDIA's demand for proof daughter 'disabled enough' to keep funding

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks on stage with a huge TV image of him behind him

items.synopsis: Despite losing the 2020 election to Joe Biden by more than seven million votes, Donald Trump tells a Republican summit near Orlando that he would have won every state if not for widespread voter fraud.

title.children: 'We won every state': Trump ramps up his 2020 US election lies against Biden ahead of New York court appearance

image.altText: A close-up headshot of Ivanka Trump. She wears a red top and silver earrings. Her hand rests on her chin.

items.synopsis: Donald Trump's daughter distanced herself from politics and attempted a reset after her father's election loss. But she's now being forced to testify in his fraud trial, and there's a huge amount at stake.

title.children: Ivanka Trump will follow her father to court. Some observers say he has reason to worry

image.altText: A female footballer player lies on the ground after injuring her knee.

items.synopsis: Season-ending knee injuries are becoming common among female athletes in Australia's football codes, leaving medical experts  increasingly concerned with the rise in this trend.

title.children: 'Australia is about to see a tsunami of ACL injuries' warns surgeon who fixed Ellie Carpenter's knee

image.altText: A close-up shot of police tape with police vehicles in the background out of focus.

items.synopsis: A 35-year-old man has been charged with murder after a fatal shooting in the town of Wooroloo, in Perth's east, on Saturday. Police continue the search for two men involved in the incident.

title.children: Man charged with murder after fatal shooting in Perth's east which sent town into lockdown

image.altText: Aerial shot of a rural property in Menah with police vehicles circling on the road

items.synopsis: Eric James Forrest, 33, was arrested in Sydney on Sunday after David Collisson was reported missing in central west NSW last month.

title.children: 'In cold blood': NSW man charged with murder after bones discovered in tree trunk

image.altText: A yellow sign with chequered flags and a symbol with the words Stawell Motor Sports Club.

items.synopsis: A spectator has died in western Victoria at a motoring event which promoted burnouts and drift cars.

title.children: Witnesses rally after rushing to help spectator killed at burnout event in western Victoria

image.altText: a bag filled with polystyrene beads

items.synopsis: The local environmental group has described the spill as a "pollution event of an industrial scale".

title.children: Thousands of plastic beads wash up on Sunshine Coast beaches days into turtle nesting season

image.altText: A man stands in front of a garage door holding a mobile phone

items.synopsis: Telstra has apologised to a West Australian man after it dispatched a debt collector to pursue him over unpaid bills belonging to a customer with a similar name.

title.children: Telstra sends 'aggressive' debt collectors after wrong customer in case of mistaken identity

image.altText: A fire truck drives towards a tree that is engulfed in flames

items.synopsis: WA's emergency services minister says it is likely fire crews will be able to control bushfires burning south of Perth over the coming days, while an emergency warning remains in place for Serpentine.

title.children: Lives and homes still under threat by fire south of Perth, as firefighters battle several blazes

image.altText: The front of an old church. The main body of the church is missing after being burned down.

items.synopsis: Deserted churches can be found across Australia as monuments to a bygone era. But not all deconsecrated holy places are destined for a lonely, forgotten existence.

title.children: Exploring Australia's forgotten churches, and their weird and wonderful new uses

image.altText: A man and woman in hospital scrubs. The man is lying down in bed holding two fingers in a peace sign.

items.synopsis: Bernie Lehmann was at a country footy game when he felt lousy. He found out he a kidney function issue and eventually needed dialysis. Then one of his children put up her hand.

title.children: Just something that 'needed to be done': Sarah has given her dad a life-changing gift

image.altText: An aerial view of the wreckage of a small, green aircraft on grass with people in high-vis walking around it.

items.synopsis: The pilot of a light aircraft dies and his passenger is injured in a gyrocopter crash in Goulburn Weir, north of Melbourne.

title.children: Light aircraft crash in Central Victoria leaves pilot dead

image.altText: Man cuddles small grey dog in burnt out landscape.

items.synopsis: With his 14-year-old dog Zaba in his arms, "Buddy" McDonald Dodd quietly surveys the ruins of the house he dashed from as flames from the Tara bushfires came through the back door. But the 27-year RFS veteran is determined to rebuild in the community he loves.

title.children: Firefighter spends the day battling Tara blazes then loses his own home

image.altText: A man measuring his waistline.

items.synopsis: Spend some time scrolling social media and you're all but guaranteed to see an ad promising to help you with targeted fat loss. Unfortunately, it is not possible to target the location of fat loss.

title.children: Can you control where you lose weight on your body?

image.altText: An employee of DP World walking along the Melbourne wharves

items.synopsis: Lots of multinational companies use legal means to reduce the amount of tax they pay. If governments supported companies that paid more generously, it might shift the dial on what's considered acceptable.

title.children: Why do taxpayers reward companies that don't support them back?

image.altText: Man in an astronaut suit with both hands on a world globe, smiling to the camera

items.synopsis: Thomas Kenneth Mattingly played an integral role in helping Apollo 13 trio return safely home so much so that his experience was adapted into a book and a movie.

title.children: Ken Mattingly, who helped in Apollo 13 crew rescue, dies at age 87

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie speaks at a press conference.

items.synopsis: Roger Cook delivers his message to the state Labor conference in a pre-recorded video after being struck down by COVID, announcing funding to boost the number of apprentices and trainees in WA's residential construction industry.

title.children: COVID-positive WA premier announces funding for construction workers in video speech to Labor conference

image.altText: A woman's hands resting in her lap. She's wearing rings, bracelets and a watch

items.synopsis: Migrant experts say the current system gives perpetrators of family violence control over women's visa status.

title.children: 'You will be my wife otherwise no one else can have you': How Australia's migration system is failing women

image.altText: An image of the nose of an airplane, behind it is a parked car.

items.synopsis: The man drives through a barrier onto the grounds of the airport in northern Germany and reportedly shoots a weapon twice in the air, with his four-year-old daughter in the car.

title.children: 'Hostage situation' closes Hamburg airport after armed man drives through gate

image.altText: A bowl of chickpea and vegetable stew accompanied by fresh crusty bread and fresh herbs on the side.

items.synopsis: Australia exports more chickpeas than any other country, but the industry wants us to eat more at home.

title.children: How the humble chickpea put Australian pulse production on the map

image.altText: Kirrilly, left, throws her head back in laughter as she stands next to Rick, right, who laughs too.

items.synopsis: Kirrilly feels "a little bit braver" about pursuing a career in the arts after spending the day fashioning a floppy summer hat with Rick on Old People's Home for Teenagers.

title.children: What happened when a 77yo milliner Rick taught 19yo Kirrilly how to make a hat

image.altText: Young baby at Childcare, Queenstown

items.synopsis: Adel Farr was prepared to leave her beloved west coast community in Tasmania to follow her career aspirations of working with children. Then she found out she didn't have to.

title.children: Community in remote region finding a way to tackle childcare staffing shortage

image.altText: Justice Gregory Geason photographed in court.

items.synopsis: The state's Attorney-General says he is taking the matter "very seriously" and the Chief Justice has asked the judge, whom the ABC understands to be Gregory Geason, to take leave "until further notice".

title.children: Tasmanian Supreme Court judge stood down in relation to 'significant matter'

image.altText: Mike Wassing stands in front of the government's emergency services complex

items.synopsis: Specialist police are on their way out to remote Queensland and four aircraft have been grounded after three people died in a plane crash while fighting fires.

title.children: Crew lost in fatal crash near Cloncurry had travelled from a number of eastern states

image.altText: A man and a woman in high vis and helmets stand together at the base of a wind turbine.

items.synopsis: Electrician Kacee Milnes swapped her job in mining for the clean energy industry because she wanted to be part of "the way of the future", and when she got there she found a less male-dominated industry.

title.children: Women make up 39pc of the clean energy workforce. Kacee finds the industry 'more welcoming' than mining

image.altText: Workers wearing hard helmets drive to work.

items.synopsis: Chinese companies invest billions in Belt and Road nickel refining projects in Indonesia, but for people working on the frontline, conditions can be deadly.

title.children: 'Money makes the devil work': Inside the deadly working conditions of Indonesia's nickel industry

image.altText: Coloured bushfire advisory sign points to extreme wedge

items.synopsis: As hot and dry weather conditions approach with the onset of El Nino, emergency services in communities across Australia urge residents to be alert.

title.children: As a hot and dry summer approaches, authorities warn of bushfire complacency creeping into communities

image.altText: A smiling woman sits on the couch holding two babies, one in each arm

items.synopsis: Ella Jurek documented the challenges of living seven hours away from major fertility services on social media. The response she received showed she isn't alone.

title.children: Mother calls for more support for IVF patients in regional centres after three-year struggle
